giant_cell_myocarditis.label: Giant cell myocarditis
giant_cell_myocarditis.why_suspected: Typically flagged by new-onset ventricular arrhythmia (VT/VF), rapid heart failure, or AV block in patients with autoimmune comorbidities. GCM carries >70% mortality without immunosuppression â€” early diagnosis is critical.

investigations.rationale: Gold standard for GCM diagnosis. Look for: multinucleated giant cells + lymphocytic infiltrate + myocyte necrosis.
investigations.indication: New-onset VT/VF + autoimmune background + treatment non-response
investigations.expected_finding: Multinucleated giant cells with extensive myocyte necrosis and mixed inflammatory infiltrate without well-formed granulomas
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis shows lymphocytic infiltrate only, without giant cells or extensive necrosis

investigations.test: Cardiac MRI with LGE pattern analysis
investigations.rationale: Key imaging differentiator between GCM and vaccine-induced myocarditis based on late gadolinium enhancement pattern.
investigations.indication: All suspected myocarditis cases with hemodynamic stability sufficient for MRI
investigations.expected_finding: Diffuse or patchy mid-wall late gadolinium enhancement
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced pattern: inferolateral subepicardial enhancement. GCM pattern: diffuse or patchy mid-wall enhancement. This differentiation is key for causality.

investigations.rationale: Serial values (not single measurement) differentiate progressive vs self-limited myocarditis.
investigations.indication: All myocarditis cases with elevated initial troponin
investigations.expected_finding: GCM shows persistent or rising troponin without typical rise-and-fall pattern
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis typically shows troponin peak followed by resolution within days

investigations.rationale: Tracks heart failure progression typical of GCM. Rising levels indicate worsening ventricular function.
investigations.indication: All suspected GCM cases, especially with signs of heart failure
investigations.expected_finding: Persistently elevated or rising BNP/NT-proBNP indicating progressive heart failure
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis shows mild elevation with rapid normalization

investigations.rationale: Characterize arrhythmia morphology to differentiate GCM from vaccine-induced patterns.
investigations.indication: Any documented arrhythmia or palpitations in myocarditis setting
investigations.expected_finding: Polymorphic VT or sustained monomorphic VT suggests GCM
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Sinus tachycardia or brief SVT is more typical of vaccine-induced myocarditis

investigations.rationale: GCM typically progresses despite standard heart failure therapy, while vaccine-induced is often self-limited.
investigations.indication: Cases not responding to initial heart failure management
investigations.expected_finding: Progressive deterioration despite ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, and diuretics
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis typically shows clinical improvement within days with supportive care

viral_etiology.label: Viral myocarditis (infectious)
viral_etiology.why_suspected: Prodromal symptoms (fever, URI, GI), lymphocytosis, or positive viral markers suggest infectious etiology preceding the cardiac event.

investigations.rationale: Direct identification of cardiotropic viruses. PCR for enterovirus, adenovirus, parvovirus B19, HHV-6, CMV, EBV; respiratory panel if URI symptoms.
investigations.indication: Prodromal febrile illness, URI/GI symptoms preceding myocarditis
investigations.expected_finding: Positive viral PCR confirming active viral infection concurrent with myocarditis
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Positive viral PCR with compatible viral prodrome supports viral rather than vaccine etiology

investigations.rationale: If acute PCR is negative, rising antibody titers on paired serology can confirm recent viral infection.
investigations.indication: Suspected viral etiology with negative initial PCR
investigations.expected_finding: 4-fold rise in IgG titers between acute and convalescent samples (2-4 weeks apart)
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Seroconversion or significant titer rise confirms recent viral infection as alternative cause

investigations.rationale: Viral myocarditis shows focal mid-wall LGE, often in inferolateral segments. Lake Louise criteria assess myocardial edema, hyperemia, and necrosis/fibrosis.
investigations.indication: All suspected myocarditis cases with hemodynamic stability
investigations.expected_finding: Focal mid-wall or subepicardial LGE with myocardial edema on T2-weighted imaging
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Viral myocarditis LGE pattern is similar to but not identical with vaccine pattern; clinical context (prodromal illness, viral testing) is more differentiating than imaging alone

eosinophilic_myocarditis.label: Eosinophilic myocarditis
eosinophilic_myocarditis.why_suspected: Peripheral eosinophilia, recent new medication exposure, or hypersensitivity features suggest eosinophilic etiology.

investigations.rationale: Confirm peripheral eosinophilia. Eosinophil count >500/uL supports eosinophilic myocarditis.
investigations.indication: All suspected eosinophilic myocarditis cases
investigations.expected_finding: Peripheral eosinophilia (absolute eosinophil count >500/uL)
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis is not associated with peripheral eosinophilia; presence strongly favors eosinophilic etiology

investigations.rationale: Definitive diagnosis requires demonstration of eosinophilic infiltrate on biopsy.
investigations.indication: Confirmed peripheral eosinophilia with myocarditis
investigations.expected_finding: Eosinophilic infiltrate with myocyte necrosis on EMB
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis shows lymphocytic infiltrate without eosinophilic predominance

investigations.rationale: Identify recently started drugs as potential hypersensitivity triggers. Drug-induced eosinophilic myocarditis is the most common subtype.
investigations.indication: All cases with eosinophilia and recent medication changes
investigations.expected_finding: Temporal correlation between new medication start and symptom onset (typically 2-4 weeks)
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Identification of a culprit drug other than the vaccine provides an alternative explanation for the myocarditis

toxin_ici_myocarditis.label: Toxin/ICI-induced myocarditis
toxin_ici_myocarditis.why_suspected: Active immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy, concurrent myositis, or recent cardiotoxic chemotherapy suggest drug-induced myocarditis.

investigations.rationale: Concurrent CK and troponin elevation suggests myocarditis-myositis overlap syndrome characteristic of ICI toxicity.
investigations.indication: Active ICI therapy with cardiac symptoms
investigations.expected_finding: Elevated CK (skeletal muscle) alongside elevated troponin (cardiac), confirming dual-organ involvement
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis causes isolated troponin elevation without significant CK rise

investigations.rationale: Assess myocardial edema, inflammation, and LGE pattern for ICI-related myocarditis.
investigations.indication: All hemodynamically stable patients with suspected ICI myocarditis
investigations.expected_finding: Myocardial edema on T2 mapping with variable LGE pattern
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: ICI myocarditis LGE pattern can be variable; clinical context (ICI exposure) is the key differentiator

investigations.rationale: Definitive diagnosis showing lymphocytic infiltrate with CD8+ T-cell predominance characteristic of ICI myocarditis.
investigations.indication: Hemodynamic instability or diagnostic uncertainty in ICI-treated patients
investigations.expected_finding: Dense lymphocytic (CD8+ T-cell predominant) infiltrate with myocyte necrosis
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: ICI myocarditis typically shows more intense and diffuse infiltrate than vaccine-induced myocarditis

investigations.rationale: ICI myocarditis typically responds to high-dose corticosteroids. Response confirms immune-mediated mechanism.
investigations.indication: Confirmed or highly suspected ICI myocarditis
investigations.expected_finding: Clinical improvement with high-dose methylprednisolone and ICI discontinuation
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis is typically self-limited without need for immunosuppression

ischemic_heart_disease.label: Ischemic heart disease (CAD/MI)
ischemic_heart_disease.why_suspected: CAD risk factors, focal ECG changes, or prior coronary disease suggest ischemic rather than inflammatory etiology.

investigations.test: Coronary angiography or CT coronary angiogram
investigations.rationale: Definitive assessment of coronary anatomy to confirm or exclude obstructive coronary disease.
investigations.indication: CAD risk factors with troponin elevation and focal ECG changes
investigations.expected_finding: Significant coronary stenosis (>70%) or acute coronary occlusion
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Normal coronary arteries effectively rules out acute MI and supports inflammatory etiology (myocarditis)

investigations.test: Serial troponin with rise-and-fall pattern analysis
investigations.rationale: Ischemic troponin pattern (rapid rise-and-fall) differs from inflammatory pattern (sustained elevation).
investigations.indication: All cases with troponin elevation and suspected ischemic etiology
investigations.expected_finding: Rapid rise-and-fall pattern typical of acute MI
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Myocarditis troponin tends to rise more gradually and remain elevated longer than acute MI pattern

investigations.rationale: Focal/territorial ST changes indicate ischemic origin; diffuse changes suggest myocarditis.
investigations.indication: All cases with ST segment abnormalities
investigations.expected_finding: ST changes localized to a single coronary territory (inferior, anterior, or lateral)
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Myocarditis typically shows diffuse or widespread ST elevation, often with PR depression (pericarditis component)

covid19_related.label: COVID-19 related myocarditis
covid19_related.why_suspected: Active or recent COVID-19 infection, MIS-C/MIS-A criteria, or elevated D-dimer suggest COVID-19 related myocardial injury.

investigations.test: SARS-CoV-2 PCR/antigen testing at symptom onset
investigations.rationale: Confirm or exclude active COVID-19 infection at the time of cardiac symptom onset.
investigations.indication: All myocarditis cases during COVID-19 pandemic, especially with respiratory symptoms
investigations.expected_finding: Positive SARS-CoV-2 PCR or antigen test confirming active infection
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Active COVID-19 infection at myocarditis onset supports COVID-related etiology rather than vaccine-induced

investigations.rationale: Anti-N antibody indicates prior natural COVID-19 infection (not vaccine-induced, as mRNA vaccines use spike protein). Positive anti-N suggests prior COVID exposure.
investigations.indication: Post-vaccination myocarditis with uncertain COVID-19 history
investigations.expected_finding: Positive anti-N antibody indicating prior natural COVID-19 infection
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Positive anti-N in recently vaccinated patient suggests prior COVID-19 that could contribute to cardiac inflammation

investigations.test: D-dimer and inflammatory markers (ferritin, CRP, IL-6)
investigations.rationale: COVID-19 myocarditis often involves microvascular thrombosis and cytokine storm with markedly elevated inflammatory markers.
investigations.indication: Confirmed or suspected COVID-19 with cardiac involvement
investigations.expected_finding: Significantly elevated D-dimer, ferritin, and CRP suggesting hyperinflammatory/thrombotic state
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis typically shows mild CRP elevation without significant D-dimer rise or ferritin elevation

investigations.rationale: Assess for multi-system inflammatory syndrome criteria if clinical picture suggests hyperinflammatory post-COVID-19 syndrome.
investigations.indication: Multi-organ involvement following recent COVID-19, especially in pediatric patients
investigations.expected_finding: Fever, multi-organ dysfunction, elevated inflammatory markers, cardiac involvement, and evidence of prior COVID-19
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: MIS-C/MIS-A involves multi-organ inflammation beyond cardiac, which is not seen in vaccine-induced myocarditis

investigations.rationale: Differentiates prior natural infection from vaccination-only exposure. Nucleocapsid antibody is produced only after natural infection, not after mRNA vaccination (which produces only spike antibody).
investigations.indication: When MIS-C or post-infectious myocarditis is suspected AND patient was recently vaccinated
investigations.expected_finding: Positive = prior natural infection likely contributed; Negative = vaccine-triggered mechanism more likely
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Nucleocapsid-negative patient with recent vaccination and MIS-C presentation supports vaccine-triggered mechanism rather than infection-triggered

investigations.test: MIS-C inflammatory panel (ferritin, D-dimer, fibrinogen, LDH)
investigations.rationale: MIS-C has a distinctive inflammatory pattern: markedly elevated ferritin (often >500), D-dimer, and fibrinogen with lymphopenia. This pattern differs from vaccine-induced myocarditis.
investigations.indication: Pediatric/young adult with multi-organ involvement post-vaccination or post-infection
investigations.expected_finding: Ferritin >500, D-dimer elevated, fibrinogen elevated with lymphopenia suggests MIS-C pattern
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine myocarditis typically shows milder inflammatory markers without the MIS-C pattern of markedly elevated ferritin/D-dimer. Presence of MIS-C pattern warrants nucleocapsid testing to determine trigger.

autoimmune_inflammatory.label: Autoimmune/inflammatory myocarditis
autoimmune_inflammatory.why_suspected: Known autoimmune disease, positive autoimmune serologies, or multi-organ systemic inflammation suggest autoimmune-mediated cardiac involvement.

investigations.rationale: Autoimmune serologies to confirm or exclude systemic autoimmune disease as the driver of myocarditis.
investigations.indication: Known autoimmune disease or multi-organ inflammatory features with myocarditis
investigations.expected_finding: Positive ANA (high titer), positive anti-dsDNA, or low complement levels indicating active autoimmune disease
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Positive autoimmune serologies with active systemic disease support autoimmune-mediated myocarditis rather than vaccine-induced

investigations.test: ESR, CRP, ferritin for systemic inflammation
investigations.rationale: Assess degree of systemic inflammatory response. Markedly elevated inflammatory markers suggest systemic autoimmune flare.
investigations.indication: Suspected autoimmune myocarditis with multi-organ involvement
investigations.expected_finding: Markedly elevated ESR and CRP beyond what is expected for isolated myocarditis
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Vaccine-induced myocarditis shows mild to moderate CRP elevation; very high ESR/CRP/ferritin suggests systemic autoimmune process

investigations.rationale: Consider EMB for granulomatous disease (cardiac sarcoidosis) or to characterize the inflammatory infiltrate.
investigations.indication: Systemic autoimmune disease with new cardiac involvement, especially suspected sarcoidosis
investigations.expected_finding: Non-caseating granulomas (sarcoidosis), immune complex deposition (lupus), or specific inflammatory patterns
investigations.differential_from_vaccine: Granulomatous or immune complex-mediated inflammation on biopsy definitively distinguishes from vaccine-induced lymphocytic myocarditis
